last_episode_to_air.name: Christmas Special
last_episode_to_air.overview: A special festive edition hosted by the fabulous Tom Allen, who introduces Thanyia Moore and Lloyd Griffith to the stage.

name: Live at the Apollo
overview: A British stand-up comedy programme performed from the Hammersmith Apollo Theatre in west London.

episodes.name: Jack Dee & Joan Rivers
episodes.overview: Jack Dee performs live at the Apollo in Hammersmith, joined by Joan Rivers and an audience packed with celebrities.

episodes.name: Jack Dee & Ardal O'Hanlon
episodes.overview: Jack Dee performs live at the Apollo in Hammersmith, joined by Ardal O'Hanlon and a celebrity-packed audience.

episodes.name: Jack Dee & Jo Brand
episodes.overview: Jack Dee performs live at the Apollo in Hammersmith, joined by Jo Brand and a celebrity-packed audience.

episodes.name: Jack Dee & Ross Noble
episodes.overview: Jack Dee performs live at the Apollo in Hammersmith, joined by Ross Noble and a celebrity-packed audience.

episodes.name: Jack Dee & Omid Djalili
episodes.overview: Jack Dee performs live at the Apollo in Hammersmith, joined by Omid Djalili and a celebrity-packed audience.

episodes.name: Jack Dee
episodes.overview: Jack Dee performs a full set live at the Apollo in Hammersmith, to an audience packed with celebrities.

episodes.name: Jack Dee & Lee Mack
episodes.overview: Joining Jack on stage tonight is one of the UK's hottest stand-ups, star of The Sketch Show, Lee Mack. Guest stars include the cast of Footballers Wives, Michael Buerk, Quentin Wilson and Spice Girl Melanie C, and members of the public get the chance to text Jack with jokes, comments and abuse.

episodes.name: Jack Dee & Dara O'Briain
episodes.overview: Jack is joined by Irish comic Dara O'Briain, whose set includes advice on how to put know-all doctors in their place, reveals and includes an improvisation of a koala being a phone sex operator. Jack sets his sights on Ellen MacArthur, the Olympics and on audience members including Tracey Emin and Jayne Middlemiss.

episodes.name: Jack Dee
episodes.overview: Jack Dee presents a series from the Apollo theatre in London, with performances from some of his favourite comedy stars. Jack takes to the stage and lays into nursery schools, homework for kids, dentists, Antiques Roadshow and safari ballooning.

episodes.name: Jack Dee & Keith Barret
episodes.overview: Jack's guest is Wales's most famous divorcee, Keith Barret. Keith's inept attempt to give a lecture about relationships has the audience in stitches, as he stumbles through a disastrous slide show. Jack's own set takes in rough council estates, service stations, the SAS and decking out his house with freebies from hotels.

episodes.name: Jack Dee, Marcus Brigstocke & Rich Hall
episodes.overview: Marcus Brigstocke performs a stand-up set that includes his observations on everything from Pacman to Britain's 'special relationship' with America, while laconic American Rich Hall explains how Bill Gates defies gravity and exposes the secret formula behind the plots to Tom Cruise films. In Jack's own set, he teases audience guests including Neil and Christine Hamilton.

episodes.name: Jack Dee & Julian Clary
episodes.overview: Joining Jack on stage is Julian Clary, who whips the audience into a frenzy with a set where no one is safe from his wit. Jack delivers a set lambasting cold calling for gas, phone and electricity, and he also lays into chemists, mobile phones and even vacuum cleaners.

episodes.name: Jack Dee, Jason Manford & Russell Howard
episodes.overview: Host Jack Dee and guests Jason Manford and Russell Howard regale their audience with their thoughts on everything from melting polar ice caps, wimpy professional footballers and celebrity-voiced sat nav systems to canine funerals, online dating and how best to outwit muggers.

episodes.name: Jimmy Carr & Alan Carr
episodes.overview: Jimmy Carr hosts, with his special guest Alan Carr. In this show recorded in front of a packed house at the famous Hammersmith Apollo Jimmy and Alan point the finger at bullies, estate agents, phone sex lines and bread making machines.

episodes.name: Jo Brand & Michael McIntyre
episodes.overview: Comedian Jo Brand hosts special guest Michael McIntyre. In the firing line are Simon Cowell, Labiaplasties, football referees and flaming terrorists.

episodes.name: Lee Mack & Sean Lock
episodes.overview: Lee Mack hosts Sean Lock in front of a packed Hammersmith Apollo. The pair take pot shots at Riverdance, hundreds and thousands, Cockneys and starfish.

episodes.name: Joan Rivers & Patrick Kielty
episodes.overview: The undisputed Queen of the Jewish Princesses, Joan Rivers, hosts the unstoppable Patrick Kielty as they point the finger at bad parents, inept terrorists and binge drinking.

episodes.name: Dara O'Briain, Stephen K. Amos & Frankie Boyle
episodes.overview: Dara O'Briain is the host, with special guests Stephen K Amos and Frankie Boyle. Recorded live at the world famous Hammersmith Apollo, this last show of the series hammers computer geeks, Australians, the seventies and present buying.

episodes.name: Michael McIntyre, Rich Hall, Rhod Gilbert
episodes.overview: The BAFTA-nominated Live at the Apollo presents the best of British stand-up comedy, as Michael McIntyre introduces Rich Hall and Rhod Gilbert at the Hammersmith Apollo, London.

episodes.name: Al Murray, Shappi Khorsandi, Russell Kane
episodes.overview: The cream of British stand-up comedy cuts loose at London's world-famous Hammersmith Apollo, leaving the audience breathless and cheering for more. In This episode Al Murray introduces Shappi Khorsandi and Russell Kane.

episodes.name: Sean Lock, Jason Manford
episodes.overview: The cream of British stand-up comedy cut loose at London's world famous Hammersmith Apollo as Sean Lock introduces Jason Manford.

episodes.name: Dara O Briain, Frankie Boyle
episodes.overview: Ireland's king of comedy Dara O Briain hosts another evening of comedy from the Hammersmith Apollo, introducing his Celtic comedy soul brother Frankie Boyle.

episodes.name: Lenny Henry, Andy Parsons, Ed Byrne
episodes.overview: The legendary Lenny Henry hosts another evening of comedy from the Hammersmith Apollo, and introduces special guests Andy Parsons and Ed Byrne.

episodes.name: Russell Howard, Jo Brand
episodes.overview: The stand-up comedy series from London's Hammersmith Apollo concludes with Mock the Week's Russell Howard introducing Jo Brand.

episodes.name: Best of Series 4
episodes.overview: Michael McIntyre, Al Murray, Dara O Briain, Lenny Henry, Sean Lock, Russell Howard and all their guests from the 2008 series of Live at the Apollo feature in a bumper one-hour special, revisiting the cream of Britain's stand-up comedy fraternity as they perform at the legendary Hammersmith Apollo.

episodes.name: Jason Manford, Michael McIntyre
episodes.overview: Live at the Apollo's fifth series features a host of great comedy talent. The opening episode from the world famous Hammersmith Apollo features two of comedy's finest powerhouses taking to the stage. Northern funny man Jason Manford is the host, and the comedy sensation of 2009 Michael McIntyre is his special guest.

episodes.name: Rob Brydon, Sarah Millican and Jason Byrne
episodes.overview: Stand-up comedy from the world-famous Hammersmith Apollo. BAFTA-nominated actor and comedian from the Valleys Rob Brydon hosts. His special guests are funny lady Sarah Millican and Ireland's Jason Byrne.

episodes.name: Al Murray, Chris Addison and Tim Vine
episodes.overview: The pub landlord Al Murray hosts, before introducing special guests Chris Addison and pun-meister Tim Vine.

episodes.name: Rhod Gilbert and John Bishop
episodes.overview: Welsh funnyman Rhod Gilbert hosts, with a rapturous guest appearance from Liverpudlian John Bishop.

episodes.name: Ed Byrne, Adam Hills and Gina Yashere
episodes.overview: Stand-up comedy from the Hammersmith Apollo. Irish gem Ed Byrne hosts in front of a 3,500-strong audience, with guest appearances from Adam Hills and London's own Gina Yashere.

episodes.name: Alistair McGowan, Kevin Bridges and Reginald D Hunter
episodes.overview: Alistair McGowan introduces guest appearances from Scotland's young comedy prodigy Kevin Bridges and the acclaimed Reginald D Hunter.

episodes.name: Sean Lock and John Bishop
episodes.overview: Live at the Apollo returns to BBC One, showcasing the best of British comedy talent. 8 Out of 10 Cats star Sean Lock introduces Liverpool's finest, John Bishop, from the world-famous Hammersmith Apollo.

episodes.name: Lee Mack, Rich Hall, Danny Bhoy
episodes.overview: Lee Mack, comedian and star of BBC One sitcom Not Going Out, presents sets from American comic Rich Hall and Scotland's very own Danny Bhoy.

episodes.name: Dara O'Briain, Stewart Francis, Greg Davies
episodes.overview: Mock the Week's Dara O Briain takes to the stage of London's Hammersmith Apollo to wax comically lyrical and to introduce Canadian one-liner specialist Stewart Francis and towering stand-up Greg Davies.

episodes.name: Kevin Bridges, Shappi Khorsandi, Jack Whitehall
episodes.overview: Stand-up comedy from the world-famous Hammersmith Apollo. Scottish comic Kevin Bridges introduces sets from Shappi Khorsandi and Jack Whitehall.

episodes.name: Stephen K Amos, Jon Richardson, Micky Flanagan
episodes.overview: Stephen K Amos presents an evening of stand-up comedy in front of a 3,500-strong audience at the Hammersmith Apollo, with special guest appearances from the brilliant Jon Richardson and London's very own Micky Flanagan.

episodes.name: Lenny Henry, Mike Wilmot, Tommy Tiernan
episodes.overview: In the last episode of the series, our host is one of the nation's favourite funnymen, Lenny Henry. Lenny introduces truly brilliant guest appearances from Canada's King of Grouch, Mike Wilmot, and Ireland's legendary Tommy Tiernan.

episodes.name: Micky Flanagan, Seann Walsh, Jason Byrne
episodes.overview: Micky Flanagan introduces one of comedy's rising stars, Seann Walsh; and Irish favourite Jason Byrne.

episodes.name: Sean Lock, Ed Byrne, Lee Nelson
episodes.overview: This episode from the world famous Hammersmith Apollo features Sean Lock as host. Special guests are the inimitable Ed Byrne and the well good Lee Nelson.

episodes.name: Alan Carr, Andi Osho, Patrick Kielty
episodes.overview: Chatty Man Alan Carr introduces, in his own inimitable style, sets from the fabulous Andi Osho and the always magnificent Patrick Kielty.

episodes.name: Andy Parsons, Andrew Lawrence, Milton Jones
episodes.overview: Mock the Week star Andy Parsons hosts stand-up comedy from the Apollo, with special guests including the fantastic Andrew Lawrence, and one-liner king Milton Jones.

episodes.name: Rich Hall, Mark Watson, Andrew Maxwell
episodes.overview: Rich Hall guest-hosts the stand-up show recorded at London's Hammersmith Apollo, inviting comedians to share their light-hearted views on modern life. Tonight he introduces routines by Mark Watson and Andrew Maxwell.

episodes.name: Sarah Millican, Steve Hughes, Russell Kane
episodes.overview: Host Sarah Millican is joined by Australian funnyman Steve Hughes and the award-winning Russell Kane.

episodes.name: Jason Manford, Tom Stade, Jimeoin
episodes.overview: Host Sarah Millican is joined by Australian funnyman Steve Hughes and the award-winning Russell Kane.

episodes.name: Jack Whitehall, Josh Widdicombe, Shappi Khorsandi
episodes.overview: Stand Up for the Week star Jack Whitehall presents comedy from the Hammersmith Apollo, with Josh Widdicombe and Shappi Khorsandi.

episodes.name: Dara O'Briain, Nina Conti and Danny Bhoy
episodes.overview: This opening episode from the world-famous Hammersmith Apollo features the brilliant Dara O Briain as host. Dara introduces ventriloquist extraordinaire Nina Conti and the irrepressible Danny Bhoy to the stage.

episodes.name: Rhod Gilbert, Kerry Godliman and Jon Richardson
episodes.overview: Welsh comic Rhod Gilbert introduces stand-up from the world-famous Hammersmith Apollo. He is joined by Kerry Godliman, and Jon Richardson at his misanthropic best.

episodes.name: Kevin Bridges, Phill Jupitus, Sara Pascoe
episodes.overview: This episode from the world-famous Hammersmith Apollo features Glasgow's Kevin Bridges as host. Kevin introduces Apollo new girl Sara Pascoe and comedy genius Phill Jupitus to the stage.

episodes.name: Lee Nelson, Stewart Francis and Paul Chowdhry
episodes.overview: The 'well good' Lee Nelson introduces stand-up from the world-famous Hammersmith Apollo. He introduces sets from one-liner king Stewart Francis and the magnificent Paul Chowdhry.

episodes.name: Omid Djalili, Julian Clary and Reginald D. Hunter
episodes.overview: The fantastic Omid Djalili presents stand-up from the world-famous Hammersmith Apollo. He introduces Alabama's finest, Reginald D Hunter, and camp legend Julian Clary to the stage.

episodes.name: Greg Davies, Hal Cruttenden and Simon Evans
episodes.overview: Greg Davies presents stand-up from the world-famous Hammersmith Apollo, introducing sets from Hal Cruttenden and Simon Evans.

episodes.name: Eddie Izzard, Trevor Noah, Josh Widdicombe
Jack Dee, Seann Walsh, Milton Jones
Sean Lock, Romesh Ranganathan, Marcus Brigstocke
Adam Hills, Andi Osho, Terry Alderton
Jack Whitehall, Katherine Ryan, Rich Hall
Nina Conti, Rob Beckett, Jimeoin
Sarah Millican, Joe Lycett and Russell Kane
episodes.overview: Sarah Millican hosts an evening of stand-up at the Apollo in Hammersmith, London, treating the audience to her own brand of humour, before introducing routines by camp comic Joe Lycett and award-winning funnyman Russell Kane.

episodes.name: Jason Manford, Chris Ramsey and Doc Brown
episodes.overview: Comedian, actor and presenter Jason Manford hosts an evening of stand-up at the Apollo in Hammersmith, London, treating the audience to his own brand of humour, before introducing routines by Geordie favourite Chris Ramsey and the multi-talented Doc Brown.

episodes.name: Frankie Boyle, Simon Evans and Aisling Bea
episodes.overview: Outspoken funnyman Frankie Boyle hosts an evening of stand-up at the Apollo in Hammersmith, London, treating the audience to his own brand of humour before handing over to the acerbic Simon Evans and actress/stand-up Aisling Bea.

episodes.name: Jon Richardson, Sara Pascoe and Nathan Caton
episodes.overview: Jon Richardson, team captain on 8 Out of 10 Cats, hosts an evening of stand-up at the Apollo in Hammersmith, west London, warming up the crowd before introducing routines by fellow comics Sara Pascoe and Nathan Caton.

episodes.name: Hal Cruttenden, Justin Moorhouse and Tom Stade
episodes.overview: Hal Cruttenden hosts an evening of stand-up at the Apollo in Hammersmith, London, warming up the audience before comedy circuit regulars Justin Moorhouse and Tom Stade take the mic.

episodes.name: Danny Bhoy, Miles Jupp and Lee Nelson
episodes.overview: Funnyman Danny Bhoy hosts an evening of stand-up at the Apollo in Hammersmith, London, warming up the audience before introducing routines by actor-comedian Miles Jupp and cheeky Londoner Lee Nelson (who recently made headlines when he turned up uninvited on the X Factor stage).

episodes.name: Alan Carr, Francesca Martinez, Nish Kumar
episodes.overview: In the first episode, everyone’s favourite ‘Chatty Man’ Alan Carr is your host as he introduces two of comedy's biggest stars - the fabulously funny Francesca Martinez and rising comedy star Nish Kumar.

episodes.name: Dara O Briain, Zoe Lyons, Paul Chowdhry
episodes.overview: Mock the Week host Dara O Briain comperes an evening of stand-up at London's Hammersmith Apollo, treating the audience to his own brand of humour, before introducing routines by comedy circuit stars Zoe Lyons and Paul Chowdhry.

episodes.name: Noel Fielding, Dane Baptiste, Al Porter
episodes.overview: One half of The Mighty Boosh and Never Mind the Buzzcocks team captain Noel Fielding takes over the hosting reins of the long-running show as he comperes an evening of stand-up at London's Hammersmith Apollo. The comedian, actor, artist, DJ and musician treats the audience to his own peculiar brand of surreal humour, before introducing routines by two up-and-coming stars of the comedy circuit, with south Londoner Dane Baptiste and Irishman Al Porter taking to the stage at the famous venue.

episodes.name: Romesh Ranganathan, Jason Byrne, Stewart Francis
episodes.overview: Romesh Ranganathan comperes an evening of stand-up at London's Hammersmith Apollo, treating the audience to his own brand of humour before introducing routines by comedy circuit stars Jason Byrne and Stewart Francis.

episodes.name: Katherine Ryan, Henning Wehn, James Acaster
episodes.overview: Katherine Ryan comperes an evening of stand-up at London's Hammersmith Apollo, treating the audience to her own brand of humour and introducing routines by comedy circuit stars Henning Wehn and James Acaster

episodes.name: Russell Kane, Roisin Conaty, Nick Helm
episodes.overview: Russell Kane comperes an evening of stand-up at London's Hammersmith Apollo, treating the audience to his own brand of humour and introducing routines by comedy circuit stars Roisin Conaty and Nick Helm.

episodes.name: Christmas Special: Nina Conti, Tanyalee Davis, Hal Cruttenden, Josh Widdicombe
episodes.overview: In the fabulously festive final episode from the legendary Hammersmith Apollo, the incredible Nina Conti is the host, introducing the brilliant Tanyalee Davis, Royal Variety Show favourite Hal Cruttenden and star of The Last Leg and Mock The Week Josh Widdicombe

episodes.name: Sarah Millican, Tom Allen, Arj Barker
episodes.overview: The fabulously funny Sarah Millican hosts, as she introduces rising comedy star Tom Allen and US comedian Arj Barker to the stage.

episodes.name: Josh Widdicombe, Celia Pacquola, Nathan Caton
episodes.overview: This week, star of the BBC sitcom Josh, and The Last Leg, Josh Widdicombe, hosts as he introduces the brilliant Nathan Caton and Australian comic Celia Pacquola to the stage.

episodes.name: Gina Yashere, Ellie Taylor, Sam Simmons
episodes.overview: In this week's third episode, multi-award winning Gina Yashere hosts as she introduces surreal Australian comedian Sam Simmons and rising comedy star Ellie Taylor to the stage.

episodes.name: Adam Hills, Jamali Maddox, Michelle Wolf
episodes.overview: Adam Hills hosts with guests Jamali Maddox and Michelle Wolf.

episodes.name: Frankie Boyle, Jack Carroll, Holly Walsh
episodes.overview: In the fifth episode, Glaswegian comedy giant Frankie Boyle is your host as he introduces young stand-up sensation Jack Carroll and the wonderful Holly Walsh to the stage.

episodes.name: Joe Lycett, Ivo Graham, Phil Wang
episodes.overview: Joe Lycett hosts with guests Ivo Graham and Phil Wang.

episodes.name: Christmas Special: Romesh Ranganathan, Kerry Godliman, Seann Walsh, Spencer Jones
episodes.overview: Romesh Ranganathan hosts this festive special, with guests Kerry Godliman, Seann Walsh and Spencer Jones.

episodes.name: Sara Pascoe, Larry Dean, Gary Delaney
episodes.overview: This episode of the award-winning Live at the Apollo is hosted by the awesome Sara Pascoe as she introduces rising comedy star Larry Dean and master of the one-liner Gary Delaney to the stage.

episodes.name: Nish Kumar, Luisa Omielan, David O'Doherty
episodes.overview: The talented Nish Kumar is your host for this episode of the award-winning Live at the Apollo as he introduces Luisa Omielan and David O'Doherty to the famous Apollo stage.

episodes.name: Rob Beckett, Jen Brister, Darren Harriott
episodes.overview: In this episode, the hilarious Rob Beckett is your host as he introduces rising comedy stars Jen Brister and Darren Harriott to the stage.

episodes.name: Henning Wehn, Lucy Porter, Guz Khan
episodes.overview: This episode is hosted by the eccentric Henning Wehn as he introduces to the stage the delightful Lucy Porter and the hilarious Guz Khan.

episodes.name: Dane Baptiste, Desiree Burch, Chris McCausland
episodes.overview: This episode is hosted by the fantastic Dane Baptiste as he introduces New York-born comic Desiree Burch and Liverpool funnyman Chris McCausland to the stage.

episodes.name: Ed  Byrne, Angela Barnes, Geoff Norcott
episodes.overview: Irish comedy star Ed Byrne hosts this episode, introducing the fantastic Angela Barnes and the wonderful Geoff Norcott to the world-famous Apollo stage.

episodes.name: Christmas Special: Katherine Ryan introduces Marlon Davis, Joel Dommett, John Robins
episodes.overview: Stand-up comedy from the Hammersmith Apollo. The funny and fabulous Katherine Ryan introduces Marlon Davis, Joel Dommett and John Robins to the stage.

episodes.name: Ellie Taylor, Fin Taylor, Tez Ilyas
episodes.overview: The first episode of the series is hosted by the wonderfully witty star of BBC Two's The Mash Report Ellie Taylor, as she introduces rising comedy star Fin Taylor and the provocative Tez Ilyas to the stage.

episodes.name: Dara O Briain, Felicity Ward, Mo Gilligan
episodes.overview: Stand-up comedy from the Hammersmith Apollo. Dara O Briain introduces the wonderful Australian comic Felicity Ward and the sensational Mo Gilligan to the stage.

episodes.name: Gina Yashere, Lost Voice Guy, Ed Gamble
episodes.overview: Stand-up comedy from the Hammersmith Apollo. The uproarious Gina Yashere hosts and introduces Lost Voice Guy and Ed Gamble to the stage.

episodes.name: Phil Wang, Rachel Parris, Brennan Reece
episodes.overview: Stand-up comedy from the Hammersmith Apollo. The hilarious Phil Wang introduces talented musical-comedian Rachel Parris and the charismatic Brennan Reece to the stage.

episodes.name: Suzi Ruffell, Kerry Godliman, Loyiso Gola
episodes.overview: Stand-up comedy from the Hammersmith Apollo. The hysterically funny Kerry Godliman introduces the energetic Suzi Ruffell and South African comedian Loyiso Gola to the stage.

episodes.name: Sindhu Vee, Jamali Maddix, Fern Brady
episodes.overview: Sindhu Vee, Jamali Maddix and Fern Brady perform.

episodes.name: Christmas Special: Sarah Millican, Gary Delaney; Laura Lexx, Ahir Shah
episodes.overview: Sarah Millican presents her husband, award-winning gagsmith Gary Delaney; Laura Lexx and Ahir Shah.

episodes.name: Tom Allen, Rosie Jones, Kae Kurd
episodes.overview: This episode is hosted by the inimitable Tom Allen, who introduces the fantastic Rosie Jones and the wonderful Kae Kurd to the world-famous Apollo stage.

episodes.name: Sindhu Vee, Alex Edelman, Lou Sanders
episodes.overview: This episode of the award winning Live at the Apollo is hosted by the awesome Sindhu Vee as she introduces rising comedy star Alex Edelman and the fantastic Lou Sanders to the stage.

episodes.name: Guz Khan, Kiri Pritchard-McLean, Rhys James
episodes.overview: Man Like Mobeen star Guz Khan hosts the stand-up showcase recorded before a packed house at London's Hammersmith Apollo. On the bill are Kiri Pritchard-McLean and Rhys James.

episodes.name: Darren Harriott, Jessica Fostekew, Stephen Bailey
episodes.overview: The magnificent Darren Harriott introduces Jessica Fostekew and Stephen Bailey to the famous Apollo stage.

episodes.name: Ardal O’Hanlon, Mawaan Rizwan, Sara Barron
episodes.overview: This episode is hosted by the brilliant Ardal O’Hanlon, as he introduces to the stage the amazing Mawaan Rizwan and the hilarious Sara Barron.

episodes.name: Desiree Burch, Paul McCaffrey, Jonny Pelham
episodes.overview: In this episode, the hilarious Desiree Burch introduces stand-up stars Paul McCaffrey and Jonny Pelham to the stage.

episodes.name: Episode 1
episodes.overview: Liverpudlian comedian Chris McCausland hosts the first episode of the series, welcoming comedians Sophie Duker and Emmanuel Sonubi to the stage.

episodes.name: Episode 2
episodes.overview: The hilarious Loyiso Gola introduces comedians Scott Bennett and Helen Bauer to the stage.

episodes.name: Episode 3
episodes.overview: The magnificent Zoe Lyons introduces comedians Ria Lina and Tom Ward to the stage.

episodes.name: Episode 4
episodes.overview: The inimitable Larry Dean introduces comedians Harriet Kemsley and Slim to the stage.

episodes.name: Episode 5
episodes.overview: Angela Barnes hosts, introducing comedians Sarah Keyworth and Tim Renkow to the stage.

episodes.name: Episode 6
episodes.overview: The magnificent Jen Brister introduces comedians Esther Manito and Adam Rowe to the stage.

episodes.name: Rosie Jones, Eshaan Akbar & Cally Beaton (Xmas Special 2022)
episodes.overview: In this special festive edition, the fabulous Rosie Jones introduces Eshaan Akbar and Cally Beaton to the stage.

episodes.name: Ed Gamble, Tom Davis & Judi Love
episodes.overview: The brilliant Ed Gamble introduces comedians Tom Davis and Judi Love to the stage.

episodes.name: Kae Kurd, Laura Smyth & Liam Farrelly
episodes.overview: The magnificent Kae Kurd introduces comedians Laura Smyth and Liam Farrelly to the stage.

episodes.name: Kiri Pritchard-McLean, Catherine Bohart & Babatunde Aléshé
episodes.overview: The inimitable Kiri Pritchard-McLean introduces comedians Catherine Bohart and Babatunde Aléshé to the stage.

episodes.name: Geoff Norcott, Michelle De Swarte & Sean McLoughlin
episodes.overview: The hilarious Geoff Norcott introduces comedians Michelle De Swarte and Sean McLoughlin to the stage.

episodes.name: Suzi Ruffell, Alfie Brown & Sikisa Bostwick-Barnes
episodes.overview: Presented by the magnificent Suzi Ruffell, who welcomes comedians Alfie Brown and Sikisa to the stage.

episodes.name: Tez Ilyas, Spring Day & Ignacio Lopez
episodes.overview: Tez Ilyas introduces comedians Spring Day and Ignacio Lopez to the stage.

episodes.name: Nabil Abdulrashid, Jake Lambert & Rachel Fairburn
episodes.overview: The brilliant Nabil Abdulrashid introduces Jake Lambert and Rachel Fairburn to the stage.

episodes.name: Ria Lina, Lucy Beaumont & Josh Pugh
episodes.overview: Ria Lina introduces comedians Lucy Beaumont and Josh Pugh to the stage.

episodes.name: Lou Sanders, Celya AB & Neil Delamere
episodes.overview: The magnificent Lou Sanders introduces comedians Celya AB and Neil Delamere to the stage.

episodes.name: Maisie Adam, Michael Odewale & Susie McCabe
episodes.overview: Maisie Adam introduces comedians Michael Odewale and Susie McCabe to the stage.

episodes.name: Emmanuel Sonubi, Troy Hawke & Olga Koch
episodes.overview: Emmanuel Sonubi welcomes Troy Hawke and Olga Koch to the stage.

episodes.name: Stephen Bailey, Lara Ricote & Glenn Moore
episodes.overview: The inimitable Stephen Bailey welcomes comedians Lara Ricote and Glenn Moore to the stage.

episodes.name: Christmas Special
episodes.overview: A special festive edition hosted by the fabulous Tom Allen, who introduces Thanyia Moore and Lloyd Griffith to the stage.
